zoAdc.h : Avr ADC peripheral function library.
[Avr Hardware Drivers]

Defines

#define ZO_ADC_DEFAULT_TRIGGER   ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_FREE_RUNNING
 Default trigger source for the ADC.
#define ZO_ADC_DEFAULT_PRESCALER   ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_128
 Default prescaler of the ADC clock (AdcClock = SystemClock/AdcPrescaler).
#define ZO_ADC_DEFAULT_REFERENCE   ZO_ADC_REFERENCE_AVCC
 Default voltage reference for the ADC.

Enumerations

enum  ZO_ADC_PRESCALE {
  ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_2 = 0x00, ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_4 = 0x02, ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_8, ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_16,
  ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_32, ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_64, ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_128
}
enum  ZO_ADC_REFERENCE { ZO_ADC_REFERENCE_AREF = 0x00, ZO_ADC_REFERENCE_AVCC = 0x40, ZO_ADC_REFERENCE_1V1 = 0xC0 }
enum  ZO_ADC_TRIGGER {
  ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_FREE_RUNNING = 0x00, ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_ANALOG_COMPARATOR, ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_EXTINT_0, ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER0_COMPARE_MATCH_A,
  ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER0_OVFL, ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER1_COMPARE_MATCH_B, ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER1_OVFL, ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER1_ICP,
  ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION
}
enum  ZO_ADC_CHANNEL {
  ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_0 = 0, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_1, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_2, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_3,
  ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_4, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_5, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_6, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_7,
  ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_TEMPERATURE, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_1V1, ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_GND
}

Functions

void zoAdcInit (void)
 Initializes the ADC peripheral. Always call this function prior to any other in this library file.
void zoAdcChannelEnable (ZO_ADC_CHANNEL channel)
 Enables an ADC channel for conversion. This function can be called multiple times in user code in order to enable all desired ADC channels.
u16 zoAdcRead (ZO_ADC_CHANNEL channel)
 Reads the voltage present at the specified ADC channel.
void zoAdcSetPrescaler (ZO_ADC_PRESCALE prescale)
 Configures the ADC clock prescaler. The ADC clock frequency is produced by dividing the system clock frequency with the prescaler value: AdcClockHz = SystemClockHz/AdcPrescaler.
void zoAdcSetReference (ZO_ADC_REFERENCE ref)
 Configures the ADC voltage reference source.
void zoAdcSetTrigger (ZO_ADC_TRIGGER trig)
 Configures the ADC start conversion trigger condition. All trigger conditions except the ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION enable the ADC auto trigger mode: ie when the trigger condition is detected an ADC conversion will be automatically triggered by the hardware. There is no need to issue a zoAdcStartConversion() at any time when this kind of ADC triggering is used. In ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_FREE_RUNNING mode the end of the last conversion triggers the start of the next ADC conversion: ie the ADC is constantly sampling and converting the ADC inputs.
void zoAdcChannelDisable (ZO_ADC_CHANNEL channel)
 Disables an ADC channel for conversion. This function can be called multiple times in user code. If all channels are disabled used this function, the ADC ISR is also disabled.
void zoAdcStartConversion (ZO_ADC_CHANNEL channel)
 Starts a conversion. This function should be used with the ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION ADC triggering scheme.
bool zoAdcConversionCompleted (void)
 Starts a conversion. This function should be used with the ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION ADC triggering scheme.
void zoAdcOff (void)
 Disable and turn off ADC completely. Power to the ADC peripheral is also disabled.

Detailed Description

Overview
The ADC library provides functionality for the ADC peripheral module of an AVR processor.
Usage example: Free running mode. 
 #include "zoAdc.h"
 #include "zoTypes.h"

 int main(void)
 {
    u16 adcResultChannel0,adcResultChannel3;
    zoAdcInit();                                            //initialize ADC
    zoAdcChannelEnable(ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_0);                   //enable ADC0
    zoAdcChannelEnable(ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_3);                   //enable ADC3

    while(1)
    {
        adcResultChannel0 = zoAdcRead(ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_0);    //read ADC0
        adcResultChannel3 = zoAdcRead(ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_3);    //read ADC3
    }
 }
Usage example: Single conversion.
 #include "zoAdc.h"
 #include "zoTypes.h"

 int main(void)
 {
    u16 adcResultChannel0;
    zoAdcInit();                                            //initialize ADC
    zoAdcSetTrigger(ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION);      //configure single 
                                                            //conversion
    zoAdcChannelEnable(ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_0);                   //enable ADC0

    while(1)
    {
        zoAdcStartConversion(ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_0);             //start conversion 
        while(!zoAdcConversionCompleted());                 //wait for adc to finish
        adcResultChannel0 = zoAdcRead(ZO_ADC_CHANNEL_0);    //read ADC0 result
    }
 }

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ZO_ADC_PRESCALE

Prescaler configuration enumeration. Use one of the enumeration values as an argument to the zoAdcSetPrescaler() function

Enumerator:
ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_2 

adcClock = SystemClock / 2

ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_4 

adcClock = SystemClock / 4

ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_8 

adcClock = SystemClock / 8

ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_16 

adcClock = SystemClock / 16

ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_32 

adcClock = SystemClock / 32

ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_64 

adcClock = SystemClock / 64

ZO_ADC_PRESCALE_128 

adcClock = SystemClock / 128

enum ZO_ADC_REFERENCE

Adc reference configuration enumeration. Use one of the enumeration values as an argument to the zoAdcSetReference() function

Enumerator:
ZO_ADC_REFERENCE_AREF 

Select the AREF pin as the ADC voltage reference.

ZO_ADC_REFERENCE_AVCC 

Select the AVcc pin as the ADC voltage reference.

ZO_ADC_REFERENCE_1V1 

Select the internal bandgap voltage as the ADC voltage reference.

enum ZO_ADC_TRIGGER

Adc trigger configuration enumeration. Use one of the enumeration values as an argument to the zoAdcSetTrigger() function

Enumerator:
ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_FREE_RUNNING 

The end of a conversion triggers the next conversion.

ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_ANALOG_COMPARATOR 

An analog comparator event triggers the next conversion.

ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_EXTINT_0 

An external interrupt triggers the next conversion.

ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER0_COMPARE_MATCH_A 

A compare match A on timer 0 triggers the next conversion.

ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER0_OVFL 

A timer o overflow triggers the next conversion.

ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER1_COMPARE_MATCH_B 

A compare match B on timer 1 triggers the next conversion.

ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_TIMER1_OVFL 

An.

enum ZO_ADC_CHANNEL

Adc trigger configuration enumeration. Use one of the enumeration values as an argument to the zoAdcChannelEnable(), zoAdcChannelDisable(), zoAdcStartConversion(), zoAdcRead() functions

Function Documentation

void zoAdcChannelEnable ( ZO_ADC_CHANNEL  channel  ) 

Enables an ADC channel for conversion. This function can be called multiple times in user code in order to enable all desired ADC channels.

Parameters:
channel The ADC channel to enable.
u16 zoAdcRead ( ZO_ADC_CHANNEL  channel  ) 

Reads the voltage present at the specified ADC channel.

Parameters:
channel The ADC channel to sample.Choose on of the ZO_ADC_CHANNEL enumeration values
Returns:
The 10-bit value that was produced by the analog to digital conversion.
void zoAdcSetPrescaler ( ZO_ADC_PRESCALE  prescale  )  [inline]

Configures the ADC clock prescaler. The ADC clock frequency is produced by dividing the system clock frequency with the prescaler value: AdcClockHz = SystemClockHz/AdcPrescaler.

Parameters:
prescale The prescale value. Choose one of the ZO_ADC_PRESCALE enumeration values
void zoAdcSetReference ( ZO_ADC_REFERENCE  ref  )  [inline]

Configures the ADC voltage reference source.

Parameters:
ref The ADC voltage reference. Choose one of the ZO_ADC_REFERENCE enumeration values
void zoAdcSetTrigger ( ZO_ADC_TRIGGER  trig  )  [inline]

Configures the ADC start conversion trigger condition. All trigger conditions except the ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION enable the ADC auto trigger mode: ie when the trigger condition is detected an ADC conversion will be automatically triggered by the hardware. There is no need to issue a zoAdcStartConversion() at any time when this kind of ADC triggering is used. In ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_FREE_RUNNING mode the end of the last conversion triggers the start of the next ADC conversion: ie the ADC is constantly sampling and converting the ADC inputs.

Parameters:
trig The ADC triggering condition. Choose one of the ZO_ADC_TRIGGER enumeration values
void zoAdcChannelDisable ( ZO_ADC_CHANNEL  channel  ) 

Disables an ADC channel for conversion. This function can be called multiple times in user code. If all channels are disabled used this function, the ADC ISR is also disabled.

Parameters:
channel The ADC channel to disable.
void zoAdcStartConversion ( ZO_ADC_CHANNEL  channel  ) 

Starts a conversion. This function should be used with the ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION ADC triggering scheme.

Parameters:
channel The ADC channel to sample.
bool zoAdcConversionCompleted ( void   )  [inline]

Starts a conversion. This function should be used with the ZO_ADC_TRIGGER_SINGLE_CONVERSION ADC triggering scheme.

Parameters:
channel The ADC channel to sample.
